Sounds like a duplicate of bug 34940.  This was supposedly fixed in 
>v20030324.  What build are you running?  If you are having this problem in 
recent 3.0 builds, please reopen bug 34940.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 34940 ***

Actually I downloaded eclipse-platform-2.0-win32.zip which is an old version. 
However, eclipse-platform-3.0M9-win32.zip also fails on startup (log follows 
this). These have been downloaded from the UK mirror. What is the official 
latest stable version and where should I get it from?

Ciaran,

Eclipse 3.0 RC2 would be a good candidate.

Maybe Eclipse M9 would work if you use a fresh workspace? The stack trace in 
comment 3 is unrelated to the one in the first description. If you repeatedly 
see this problem with Eclipse 3.0 RC2, I suggest opening a bug report against 
Platform / Core.
